No information available for this conten: No information available for this content. Decrease scope aggregation to get more details.
You may also configure subnet labels in: You may also configure subnet labels in the FlowCollector resource (spec.processor.subnetLabels) to identify IP ranges that are external to the cluster.
Can't find metrics for this element. Che: Can't find metrics for this element. Check your capture filters to ensure we can monitor it. Else it probably means there is no traffic here.
When in \"Match any\" mode, try using on: When in "Match any" mode, try using only Namespace, Owner or Resource filters (which use indexed fields), or decrease limit / range, to improve the query performance
Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters: Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters (which use indexed fields), or decrease limit / range, to improve the query performance
Add more filters or decrease limit / ran: Add more filters or decrease limit / range to improve the query performance
The flow contains packets with various f: The flow contains packets with various flags:
ICMP type provided but protocol is {{pro: ICMP type provided but protocol is {{proto}}
ICMP code provided but protocol is {{pro: ICMP code provided but protocol is {{proto}}
Invalid data provided. Check JSON for de: Invalid data provided. Check JSON for details.
This is a partial flow: it contains only: This is a partial flow: it contains only enrichment data and is missing some basic information such as byte and packet counters, TCP flags or MAC addresses. This information can likely be found in adjacent flows.
Log type to query. A conversation is an: Log type to query. A conversation is an aggregation of flows between same peers. Only ended conversations will appear in Overview and Topology tabs.
Only available when FlowCollector.proces: Only available when FlowCollector.processor.logTypes option equals "CONNECTIONS", "ENDED_CONNECTIONS" or "ALL"
Only available when FlowCollector.processor.logTypes option equals "FLOWS" or "ALL"
Which datasource to query from console p: Which datasource to query from console plugin pod. Prometheus holds a subset of metrics compared to Loki with better performances. Select "Auto" to pick the best datasource automatically.
Only available when FlowCollector.promet: Only available when FlowCollector.prometheus.enable is true for Overview and Topology tabs
Only available when FlowCollector.loki.e: Only available when FlowCollector.loki.enable is true
Filter flows by their drop status. Only: Filter flows by their drop status. Only packets dropped by the kernel are monitored here.
Fully dropped shows the flows that are 1: Fully dropped shows the flows that are 100% dropped
Containing drops shows the flows having: Containing drops shows the flows having at least one packet dropped
Without drops show the flows having 0% d: Without drops show the flows having 0% dropped
Only available using eBPF with FlowColle: Only available using eBPF with FlowCollector.agent.ebpf.features containing "PacketDrop"
Top items for internal backend queries.
Depending on the matching and filter set: Depending on the matching and filter settings, several queries can be performed under the cover, each with this parameter set, resulting in more results after aggregation.
Force table rows to specific sizing.
A flow might be reported from both sourc: A flow might be reported from both source and destination nodes, making it appear several times. By default, duplicates are merged, but you can show them in order to get more granular data.
Measurement to show as edge labels.
Grouping items helps to better understan: Grouping items helps to better understand ownership.
The way in which topology items are arra: The way in which topology items are arranged.
Various options to show / hide view deta: Various options to show / hide view details.
The example outlined in the table demons: The example outlined in the table demonstrates a scenario that is tailored to your workload. Consider this example only as a baseline from which adjustments can be made to accommodate your needs.
The sampling interval is one of the main: The sampling interval is one of the main settings used to balance performance and accuracy. The lower the interval, the higher the accuracy.
Use the slider below to configure the de: Use the slider below to configure the desired sampling interval.
The estimations are based on the number:
The estimations are based on the number of nodes in the cluster and the sampling rate. They do not take into account the number of namespaces or pods, as their impact is comparatively lower than that of nodes.
They are calculated using a linear regression model based on data collected from various OpenShift clusters. Actual resource consumption may vary depending on your specific workload and cluster configuration.
There is some issue in this form view. P: There is some issue in this form view. Please select "YAML view" for full control.
Note: Some fields may not be represented: Note: Some fields may not be represented in this form view. Please select "YAML view" for full control.
Click reload to see the new version.
An error occured while retreiving FlowCo: An error occured while retreiving FlowCollector: {{error}}
The FlowCollector resource is used to co: The FlowCollector resource is used to configure the Network Observability operator and its managed components. When it is created, network flows start being collected.
This wizard is a helper to create a firs:
This wizard is a helper to create a first FlowCollector resource. It does not cover all the available configuration options, but only the most common ones.
For advanced configuration, please use YAML or the
, which includes more options such as:\n:
, which includes more options such as:
- Filtering options
- Configuring custom exporters
- Custom labels based on IP
- Pod identification for secondary networks
- Performance fine-tuning
You can always edit a FlowCollector later when you start with the simplified configuration.
You can create custom metrics out of the: You can create custom metrics out of the network flows using the FlowMetric API. A FlowCollector resource must be created as well in order to produce the flows. Each flow consists in a set of fields with values, such as source name and destination name. These fields can be leveraged as Prometheus labels to enable customized metrics and dashboards.
This simplified setup guides you through: This simplified setup guides you through the common aspects of the FlowMetric configuration. For advanced configuration, please use YAML or the
It will disable flow collection globally: It will disable flow collection globally. All resources managed by the FlowCollector will be deleted, such as pods and services.
The following metric will stop being col: The following metric will stop being collected:
Update by completing the form. Current v: Update by completing the form. Current values are from the existing resource.
Create by completing the form. Default v: Create by completing the form. Default values are provided as example.
No rules found, health cannot be determi: No rules found, health cannot be determined
Check alert definitions in FlowCollector: Check alert definitions in FlowCollector "spec.processor.metrics.alertGroups" and "spec.processor.metrics.disableAlerts".
Make sure that Prometheus and AlertManag: Make sure that Prometheus and AlertManager are running.
The network looks relatively healthy, wi: The network looks relatively healthy, with minor issues
{{pendingAlerts}} pending critical issue: {{pendingAlerts}} pending critical issues, from {{pendingRules}} distinct rules
No critical issues out of {{total}} rule: No critical issues out of {{total}} rules
{{pendingAlerts}} pending minor issues,: {{pendingAlerts}} pending minor issues, from {{pendingRules}} distinct rules
No minor issues out of {{total}} rules: No minor issues out of {{total}} rules
Clear or reset filters and try again.
Check for errors in health dashboard. St: Check for errors in health dashboard. Status endpoint is returning: {{statusError}}
Add missing metrics to prometheus in the: Add missing metrics to prometheus in the FlowCollector API (processor.metrics.includeList)
Enable Loki in the FlowCollector API (lo: Enable Loki in the FlowCollector API (loki.enable)
Reduce the Query Options -> limit to red: Reduce the Query Options -> limit to reduce the number of results
Increase Loki \"max_entries_limit_per_qu: Increase Loki "max_entries_limit_per_query" entry in configuration file
Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters: Add Namespace, Owner or Resource filters (which use indexed fields) to improve the query performance
Reduce limit and time range to decrease: Reduce limit and time range to decrease the number of results
Increase time step to decrease the numbe: Increase time step to decrease the number of parallel queries
Ensure Loki config contains \"parallelis: Ensure Loki config contains "parallelise_shardable_queries: true" and "max_outstanding_requests_per_tenant: 2048"
Reduce the time range to decrease the nu: Reduce the time range to decrease the number of results
Increase Loki \"max_query_length\" entry: Increase Loki "max_query_length" entry in configuration file
This error is generally seen when cluste: This error is generally seen when cluster admin groups are not properly configured.
Click the link below for more help.
Check your connectivity with cluster / c: Check your connectivity with cluster / console plugin pod
This deployment mode does not support no: This deployment mode does not support non-admin users. Check FlowCollector spec.loki.manual.authToken
For LokiStack, your user must either:: For LokiStack, your user must either:
have the 'netobserv-loki-reader' cluster: have the 'netobserv-loki-reader' cluster role, which allows multi-tenancy
or be in the 'cluster-admin' group (not: or be in the 'cluster-admin' group (not the same as the 'cluster-admin' role)
or LokiStack spec.tenants.openshift.admi: or LokiStack spec.tenants.openshift.adminGroups must be configured with a group this user belongs to
For other configurations, refer to FlowC: For other configurations, refer to FlowCollector spec.loki.manual.authToken
For metrics access, your user must eithe: For metrics access, your user must either:
or for cluster-wide access, have the 'cl: or for cluster-wide access, have the 'cluster-monitoring-view' cluster role
You may consider the following changes t: You may consider the following changes to avoid this error:
Check if Loki is running correctly. '/re: Check if Loki is running correctly. '/ready' endpoint should respond "ready"
Can't find any namespace label in your L: Can't find any namespace label in your Loki storage.
Can't find any namespace label in your P: Can't find any namespace label in your Prometheus storage.
If this is the first time you run the op: If this is the first time you run the operator, check FlowCollector status and health dashboard to ensure there is no error and flows are ingested. This can take some time.
Loki and Prometheus storages are divergi: Loki and Prometheus storages are diverging. The number of captured namespaces does't match. Check health dashboard for errors.
Zoom in / zoom out the histogram display: Zoom in / zoom out the histogram displayed time range. The selected time range in the top right corner will adapt accordingly. You can also use the plus or minus buttons while the histogram is focused.
Move the selected range to filter the ta: Move the selected range to filter the table below as time based pagination. You can also use the page up or down buttons while the histogram is focused.
Shift the histogram displayed time range: Shift the histogram displayed time range. The selected time range in the top right corner will adapt accordingly. You can also use the arrow left or right buttons while the histogram is focused.
The following bar chart represents the n: The following bar chart represents the number of logs over time. You can select a portion of it to drill down into the selected time range, accordingly/consequently filtering the following flows information.
No datapoints found in the selected time: No datapoints found in the selected time range
Reset time range and try again.
Selected columns will appear in the tabl: Selected columns will appear in the table.
Click and drag the items to reorder the: Click and drag the items to reorder the columns in the table.
At least one column must be selected: At least one column must be selected
Following query will be exported as CSV: Following query will be exported as CSV format:
Use this option to export every fields a: Use this option to export every fields and labels from flows.
Selected panels will appear in the overv: Selected panels will appear in the overview tab.
Click and drag the items to reorder the: Click and drag the items to reorder the panels in the overview tab.
At least one panel must be selected: At least one panel must be selected
From date cannot be in the future: From date cannot be in the future
To date must be after From date: To date must be after From date
Select a custom time range. Flows are se: Select a custom time range. Flows are selected based on their End Time value.
Collection latency could be up to {{maxC: Collection latency could be up to {{maxChunkAge}} corresponding to the current Loki "max_chunk_age" ingester configuration.

Show scope-internal traffic, depending o: Show scope-internal traffic, depending on the selected scope (e.g. node-internal traffic, namespace-internal traffic)
Show out of scope traffic (e.g. host-net: Show out of scope traffic (e.g. host-network traffic when scope is different from "Node")

Sorry, 3D view is not implemented anymor: Sorry, 3D view is not implemented anymore.

More than operator is not allowed with `: More than operator is not allowed with `{{searchValue}}`. Use equals or contains operators instead.
Contains operator is not allowed with `{: Contains operator is not allowed with `{{searchValue}}`. Use equals or more than operators instead.
Invalid format. The input should be <fil: Invalid format. The input should be <filter><comparator><value> such as `name=netobserv`.
the logical OR operator is used between: the logical OR operator is used between each values of the same filter.
The logical OR operator is used between: The logical OR operator is used between filters.
The logical AND operator is used between: The logical AND operator is used between Endpoints and common filters. The traffic is matched in both directions.
The logical AND operator is used between filters keeping direction source to destination.
Select a field name to filter on. Use in: Select a field name to filter on. Use indexed fields in bold to improve your query performances.

Name: not a valid Kubernetes name: Name: not a valid Kubernetes name
